verses.verse: "Call <WH7121> now; <WH3426> is there any who will answer <WH6030> you? <WH6918> To which of the holy ones will you turn? <WH6437>
For resentment <WH3708> kills <WH2026> the foolish man, <WH191> and jealousy <WH7068> kills <WH4191> the simple. <WH6601>
I have seen <WH7200> the foolish <WH191> taking root, <WH8327> but suddenly <WH6597> I cursed <WH5344> his habitation. <WH5116>
His children <WH1121> are far <WH7368> from safety. <WH3468> They are crushed <WH1792> in the gate. <WH8179> Neither is there any to deliver them, <WH5337>
whose harvest <WH7105> the hungry <WH7457> eats up, <WH398> and take it even out <WH413> of the thorns. <WH6791> The snare <WH6782> gapes <WH7602> for their substance. <WH2428>
For affliction <WH205> doesn't <WH3318> come forth from the dust, <WH6083> neither does trouble <WH5999> spring out <WH6779> of the ground; <WH127>
but man <WH120> is born <WH3205> to trouble, <WH5999> as the sparks <WH1121> fly <WH5774> upward. <WH1361>
"But as for me, <WH199> I would seek God. <WH430> I would commit <WH7760> my cause <WH1700> to God, <WH430>
who does <WH6213> great things <WH1419> that can't <WH369> be fathomed, marvelous things <WH6381> without number; <WH4557>
who gives <WH5414> rain <WH4306> on <WH6440> the earth, <WH776> and sends <WH7971> waters <WH4325> on <WH6440> the fields; <WH2351>
so that he sets up <WH7760> on high <WH4791> those who are low, <WH8217> those who mourn <WH6937> are exalted <WH7682> to safety. <WH3468>
He frustrates <WH6565> the devices <WH4284> of the crafty, <WH6175> So that their hands <WH3027> can't <WH6213> perform their enterprise. <WH8454>
He takes <WH3920> the wise <WH2450> in their own craftiness; <WH6193> the counsel <WH6098> of the cunning <WH6617> is carried headlong. <WH4116>
They meet <WH6298> with darkness <WH2822> in the day time, <WH3119> and grope <WH4959> at noonday <WH6672> as in the night. <WH3915>
But he saves <WH3467> from the sword <WH2719> of their mouth, <WH6310> even the needy <WH34> from the hand <WH3027> of the mighty. <WH2389>
So the poor <WH1800> has hope, <WH8615> and injustice <WH5766> shuts <WH7092> her mouth. <WH6310>
"Behold, <WH835> happy is the man <WH582> whom God <WH433> corrects. <WH3198> Therefore do not despise <WH3988> the chastening <WH4148> of the Almighty. <WH7706>
For he wounds, <WH3510> and binds up. <WH2280> He injures, <WH4272> and his hands <WH3027> make whole. <WH7495>
He will deliver <WH5337> you in six <WH8337> troubles; <WH6869> yes, <WH7651> in seven no evil <WH7451> shall touch you. <WH5060>
In famine <WH7458> he will redeem <WH6299> you from death; <WH4194> in war, <WH4421> from the power <WH3027> of the sword. <WH2719>
You shall be hidden <WH2244> from the scourge <WH7752> of the tongue, <WH3956> neither shall you be afraid <WH3372> of destruction <WH7701> when it comes. <WH935>
At destruction <WH7701> and famine <WH3720> you shall laugh, <WH7832> neither shall you be afraid <WH3372> of the animals <WH2416> of the earth. <WH776>
For you shall be allied <WH1285> with the stones <WH68> of the field. <WH7704> The animals <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> shall be at peace with you. <WH7999>
You shall know <WH3045> that your tent <WH168> is in peace. <WH7965> You shall visit <WH6485> your fold, <WH5116> and shall miss nothing. <WH2398>
You shall know <WH3045> also that your seed <WH2233> shall be great, <WH7227> Your offspring <WH6631> as the grass <WH6212> of the earth. <WH776>
You shall come <WH935> to your grave <WH6913> in a full age, <WH3624> like a shock of grain <WH1430> comes in <WH5927> its season. <WH6256>
Look this, <WH2713> we have searched it, <WH8085> so it is. Hear it, <WH3045> and know it for your good."
